intro: Neuwiedia inae, commonly known as the New Guinea bellflower, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the highlands of New Guinea and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and prefers well-drained soil. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Neuwiedia inae is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in cooler climates.
